com.percussion.design.objectstore
Class PSDatabaseComponent

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDatabaseComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSComponent, IPSDatabaseComponent, Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
PSDatabaseComponentCollection, PSRole, PSSubject
public abstract class PSDatabaseComponent
extends Object
implements IPSDatabaseComponent

This interface is used by Object store components whose state is saved in a database rather than an XML file. The objects are still XML based. The object uses this interface to serialize itself to and from a back end database via a different XML format and a Rx application.

Field Detail

m_componentState

protected int m_componentState
The component state, initially DATABASE_COMPONENT_INSERTED which is the default for any administrative calls. Components which are loading themselves from the back end table should set this to DATABASE_COMPONENT_UNCHANGED at construction time.

m_databaseComponentId

protected int m_databaseComponentId
Each database component has an Id associated with it, initialized to -1, set when allocated for DB storage by a call to createDBComponentId() (for new components) or when loaded from the database (for existing components). This value is used as the key for this component in the back end database and any relationships it has with super- or sub- components.

m_id

protected int m_id
The id assigned to this component, used by the IPSComponent implementation.

ID_ATTR

protected static final String ID_ATTR
Attribute used to serialize the IPSComponent id

See Also:

Throws:
IllegalStateException - If the derived object has not properly implemented the getComponentType() method.
Method Detail

clone

public Object clone()
Description copied from interface: IPSComponent
Creates a new instance of this object, deep copying all member variables. If an implementing class has mutable member variables, it must override this method and clone() each of those variables. This method will create a shallow copy if it is not overridden.

NOTE: Currently, this method has been overridden only in a subset of the classes that require it. Only those classes recursively aggregated by PSDisplayMapper are correct.

Specified by:
clone in interface IPSComponent
Overrides:
clone in class Object
Returns:
a deep-copy clone of this instance, never null.

public int getDatabaseComponentId()
Get the database component id.

Returns:
The database component id, -1 indicates that it has not had an id allocated yet.

setDelete

protected void setDelete()
Mark this database component to become a delete action against the database, unless the component was previously created before being persisted to the database, in which case the component will be marked as discarded.

setUpdate

protected void setUpdate()
Mark this database component to be an update action to the database when it is persisted.

toDatabaseXml

public void toDatabaseXml(Document doc,
                          Element actionRoot,
                          com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSRelation relationContext)
                   throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDatabaseComponentException
Add the action(s) needed to serialize all changes made to this database component to the back end. Default case will use toXml , first handling the creation of the action row, and db component id (if necessary). Any database elements which require relation information and sub components must override this method and use the relationContext to persist their children.

Specified by:
toDatabaseXml in interface IPSDatabaseComponent
Parameters:
doc - The database modification document being created. May not be null.
actionRoot - The root element under which all DBMS actions (updates, inserts, and deletes) are to be added. May not be null or empty.
relationContext - Any relationship context information, so that new relationships may be added to the back end as needed by the components which require them. May be null indicating there is no relationship existing for this component.
Throws:
PSDatabaseComponentException - if there are errors creating the element.
See Also:
for the interface definition.

getDatabaseAppQueryDatasetName

public String getDatabaseAppQueryDatasetName()
Description copied from interface: IPSDatabaseComponent
Get the name of the dataset in the system component application which retrieves components of this type.

Specified by:
getDatabaseAppQueryDatasetName in interface IPSDatabaseComponent
Returns:

buildAppQueryDatasetName

public static String buildAppQueryDatasetName(String componentType)
Given a component type, create the name of the dataset that is used to retrieve components of this type.

Parameters:
componentType - See getComponentType() for details. Never null or empty.
Returns:
A valid name of a dataset in the sys_components application that can be used to query objects of the specified type.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If componentType is null or empty.

getDatabaseComponentIdKeyName

public String getDatabaseComponentIdKeyName()
Get the name of the key to use to identify this component from the data retrieved from the system components application. By default, this name is of the form '_id'.

Specified by:
getDatabaseComponentIdKeyName in interface IPSDatabaseComponent
Returns:
A valid identifier.

getActionElement

protected Element getActionElement(Document doc,
                                   Element actionRoot)
Get the action element associated with this database component. Classes which extend this class should call this and then proceed to add their own specific keys and values to the returned element.

Parameters:
doc - The database modification document being created, assumed not null.
actionRoot - The root element under which all DBMS actions (updates, inserts, and deletes) are to be added. May not be null.
Returns:
the action element for this database component, null indicates no action need be performed for this component at this time.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is invalid

fromDatabaseXml

public void fromDatabaseXml(Element e,
                            com.percussion.design.objectstore.server.PSDatabaseComponentLoader cl,
                            com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSRelation relationContext)
                     throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException,
                            com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDatabaseComponentException
Instantiate the values in this database component from the xml element returned by the query resource associated with this database component type. Will attempt to utilize fromXml() directly for the default case. Any database elements which require relation information and sub components must override this method and use the database component loader to retrieve it's relationships and actualize its children. Additionally they must set their m_componentState to IPSDatabaseComponent.DATABASE_COMPONENT_UNCHANGED.

Specified by:
fromDatabaseXml in interface IPSDatabaseComponent
Parameters:
e - The xml element defining this component. May not be null.
cl - The database component loader. May not be null, this is may be used to load any subcomponents.
relationContext - The current relation context, may be null if no relationship exists.
Throws:
PSUnknownNodeTypeException - if this component or one of it's sub-components fails to initialize with a supplied element.
PSDatabaseComponentException - if any othererror occurs loading this component from the database
See Also:
for the interface definition.

addComponentState

protected void addComponentState(Element e)
Adds this component's db state and database id to the supplied element. Does so by adding an attribute for each to the supplied element. See XML_COMPONENT_STATE_ATTR and IPSDatabaseComponent.DATABASE_COMPONENT_ID_XML_ATTR_NAME for the attribute name used. Convenience method used by derived classes in their toXml methods.

Parameters:
e - The element to which the state is added. May not be null .
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if e is null.

newComponentInstance

public static IPSDatabaseComponent newComponentInstance(Class c,
                                                        Element e,
                                                        com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSRelation rc,
                                                        com.percussion.design.objectstore.server.PSDatabaseComponentLoader cl)
                                                 throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDatabaseComponentException,
                                                        com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException
Constructs a component from a back end database.

Parameters:
c - The class of the IPSDatabaseComponent to create. May not be null. Must be assignable from IPSDatabaseComponent.
e - The back-end database xml element to instantiate with. May not be null.
rc - The relation context information. May not be null.
cl - The component loader to use for any needed related content. May not be null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If any argument is invalid.
PSDatabaseComponentException - If there are any problems loading the component
PSUnkownNodeTypeException - if the component can not instantiate itself from the supplied XML
com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException

getComponentState

protected void getComponentState(Element e)
                          throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException
Gets this component's db state from the supplied element and stores is Does so by checking the attribute in the supplied element. If it is not found, then the state is set to IPSDatabaseComponent.DATABASE_COMPONENT_UNCHANGED. See XML_COMPONENT_STATE_ATTR for the attribute name used. Also retrieves and sets this component's database id. See IPSDatabaseComponent.DATABASE_COMPONENT_ID_XML_ATTR_NAME for the attribute name used. Convenience method used by derived classes in their fromXml methods, and should always be used in conjuction with addComponentState(org.w3c.dom.Element) in their toXml methods.

Parameters:
e - The element from which the state is retrieved. May not be null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if e is null.
PSUnknownNodeTypeException - if the provided element does not contain the expected attributes.

getDatabaseComponentId

public static String getDatabaseComponentId(Element dbComponentElement)
                                     throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException
Returns the database component id from the specified xml element.

Parameters:
dbComponentElement - The xml element representing a database component. May not be null
Returns:
the database component id as a string, never null or empty
Throws:
PSUnknownNodeTypeException - if the element does not contain a database component id attribute.
IllegalArgumentException - if dbCopmponentElement is null

createDBComponentId

protected void createDBComponentId()
                            throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDatabaseComponentException
Generates a new component id for this component and uses it to set the value of m_databaseComponentId. This must only be called once for each new component!

Throws:
com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSDatabaseComponentException

getComponentType

public String getComponentType()
Returns the identifier for this object. By convention and default, the base class name less the leading 'PS' is used for this identifier. For example, if this class could be instantiated, it would return 'DatabaseComponent'. It wasn't made static so it could be overridden, but it is effectively static.

Returns:
A unique name for this object among all objects derived from this class, never null or empty.

validate

public void validate(com.percussion.design.objectstore.IPSValidationContext cxt)
              throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSValidationException
Description copied from interface: IPSComponent
Validates this object within the given validation context. The method signature declares that it throws PSValidationException, but the implementation must not directly throw any exceptions. Instead, it should register any errors with the validation context, which will decide whether to throw the exception (in which case the implementation of validate should not catch it unless it is to be rethrown).

Specified by:
validate in interface IPSComponent
Parameters:
cxt - The validation context.
Throws:
PSValidationException - According to the implementation of the validation context (on warnings and/or errors).
